website_summaries.verdict: Though it lacks some features found in its big phone rivals, the Nokia Lumia 1520 is a great buy for Windows Phone fans seeking a supersize smartphone with premium hardware.
pros: Nokia's Lumia 1520 delivers a large, glare-fighting screen, a fast processor, plenty of storage, and a strong 20-megapixel camera for the same on-contract price as a smaller premium phone
cons: Its size makes one-handed operation difficult, and call quality was muddier than on most Nokia phones
Limited voice dictation and voice assistance in the OS hobbles its usefulness as a phablet

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of defective phones!
customer_reviews.text: The phone was defective when it was sent to me, the screen clicks on its own (randomly without being touched) that happens a couple of seconds after the phone is unlocked and the screen is no longer responsive to touch, I have to lock and then unlock my phone to get it to work again and the cycle continues. The phone was useless for text messaging, video viewing, gaming, and other tasks. I was only able to make calls properly since when the phone is placed on the ear, the screen goes black so it is not messing up. Further, the phone overheats quickly every time is used.
customer_reviews.author: hani

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, and great phone operating system.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, and great phone operating system. Just worth noting that this is a BIG phone. It slips in my pockets fine (I'm a guy, and wear jeans/slacks a little loose) even with a bumper-style case, but handling it one-handed is definitely a challenge for all but the most basic tasks (and I'm 6' and have relatively large hands). Otherwise I love it. Great features (I love the glance screen and using Crotana's always on/listening capabilities) and the camera is quite good for a phone. It's quick (from clicking the camera button when the phone is locked and asleep to ready to shoot is about 1.5 seconds), and great for outdoor and good for indoor shots.
